title: Remove or upgrade react-native-device-info to 7.4.0
body:
# Description

The dependency on `react-native-device-info` is causing our APK to include Google dependencies that we do not use or want.

Because of this we were force to make a separate branch called [`fdroid-release/1.11.x`](https://github.com/status-im/status-react/tree/fdroid-release/1.11.x) as a [dirty fix](https://github.com/status-im/status-react/commit/f010a0cd8897077bfc9b8864cdb019ae8655bdf0) to the Google dependencies blocking inclusion of our app in the [F-Droid](https://f-droid.org/) application directory as part of [fdroidata#7179](https://gitlab.com/fdroid/fdroiddata/-/merge_requests/7179).

# Requirements

As [suggested](https://gitlab.com/fdroid/fdroiddata/-/merge_requests/7179#note_511312796) by `@Licaon_Kter` there was a fix implemented for the package in https://github.com/react-native-device-info/react-native-device-info/pull/1153 which was included in [`v7.4.0`](https://github.com/react-native-device-info/react-native-device-info/releases/tag/v7.4.0). We can either upgrade our version to `v7.4.0` or newer, or remove the dependency entirely.

But the removal of the dependency is dependent on the future of Referral program and our need for including `installreferrer`.
we can't remove referrer code as it's actively used
This project upgraded to `v8.0.0` to fix this issue: https://github.com/MBach/LeMondeRssReader/pull/36

You can verify if the build includes GoogleAPI stuff by disassembling to built APK using:
```
apktool d app-release.apk
```
And then search the resulting unpacked APK for instances of `googleapi` with `grep`/`ack`/`ag`.
I'm also adding a `make release-fdroid` target in https://github.com/status-im/status-react/pull/11791 but I'm not sure if it's ready yet.

As far as I understand this stuff:
https://github.com/status-im/status-react/blob/f71faee5c2a869485e9dfafe3de5e704838a6ca2/src/status_im/utils/config.cljs#L47
https://github.com/status-im/status-react/blob/f71faee5c2a869485e9dfafe3de5e704838a6ca2/src/status_im/acquisition/core.cljs#L111-L123
Might not be necessary after you've upgraded this dependency. But not sure.


@jakubgs i can build dev build just fine but have error above when building realease
Have you done `make nix-update-gradle`? Seems like it changes some dependencies.
yes

The missing library is:
```
> Could not resolve org.junit.jupiter:junit-jupiter-api:5.7.0.
```
But we clearly have that included in our dependencies:
```
 > grep junit nix/deps/gradle/deps.list 
junit:junit:4.12
org.junit.jupiter:junit-jupiter-api:5.7.0
org.junit.platform:junit-platform-commons:1.7.0
```
OH WAIT, i think i get it

The issue isn't `junit-jupiter-api`, it's `junit-bom`:
```
            > Could not resolve org.junit:junit-bom:5.7.0.
               > No cached version of org.junit:junit-bom:5.7.0 available for offline mode.
```
Which is related to newer version of Gradle, as I mentioned in https://github.com/status-im/go-maven-resolver/pull/5.

In that case I had trouble with:
```
> Could not find com.google.protobuf:protobuf-bom:3.10.0.
```
But this appears to be an issue specifically related to Gradle 6, and we are still on Gradle 5.
https://github.com/status-im/status-react/blob/293fd5fae1d35551e8d801de81bffabf8ca4083d/nix/overlay.nix#L36

Although if we look at the `build.gradle` of `react-native-device-info` it shows to default to `4.4.1`:
```gradle
def buildGradleVersion = ext.has('buildGradlePluginVersion') ? ext.get('buildGradlePluginVersion') : '4.1.1'
```
https://github.com/react-native-device-info/react-native-device-info/blob/v7.4.0/android/build.gradle#L10

Ah yes, Gradle Build tools `4.1.0` are indeed the issue:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2212681/109533962-1a152b00-7abb-11eb-86d0-974767c14f57.png)

https://developer.android.com/studio/releases/gradle-plugin

So either we have to apply the https://github.com/react-native-device-info/react-native-device-info/pull/1153 fix before https://github.com/react-native-device-info/react-native-device-info/commit/b79d6ca8232c4a7a8306b00933f31af0dc8fb2e9 was added and changed the default Gradle Build plugin version from `3.6.3` to `4.1.1`, or we have to upgrade to Gradle 6.

They did leave a possibility of overriding the `4.1.1` default with `buildGradlePluginVersion`:
```gradle
def buildGradleVersion = ext.has('buildGradlePluginVersion') ? ext.get('buildGradlePluginVersion') : '4.1.1'
```
So in theory we could try reverting it back to `3.6.3` by setting that.

https://docs.gradle.org/current/dsl/org.gradle.api.plugins.ExtraPropertiesExtension.html

I added the following line to `android/build.gradle` in the `ext` block:
```gradle
    buildGradlePluginVersion = project.gradlePluginVersion
```
But it fails the same way. I guess I'm missing something, or this just won't work.
i guess its because of `if (project == rootProject) {`
btw we also have `classpath "com.android.tools.build:gradle:${project.ext.gradlePluginVersion}"` where do we set it ?
prepared a fork with reverted gradle https://github.com/status-im/react-native-device-info/commits/v7.4.0-gradle but it didn't help, same error
@jakubgs

So I think my change in https://github.com/status-im/go-maven-resolver/pull/5 might actually be the fix.
I used the commit from the PR and ran `make nix-update-gradle` and it worked:
```
BUILD SUCCESSFUL in 7m 1s
1018 actionable tasks: 1018 executed
running tests
 11124078  00-00-1980 00:00   assets/index.android.bundle
installing

'/nix/store/2g55c1g1i26rl80xpkypw5qg352726wa-status-react-build-nightly-android/app-release.apk' -> './result/app-release.apk'

SUCCESS
removed '/tmp/tmp-status-react-5b7389f5a/tmp.22bhLgb8Op'
```
Maybe it might even work without the fork?
I'm gonna try reverting your last commit and see if that works too.
It worked without the fork added in 5b7389f5a. I'll try pushing without it.
